original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽14.34. Niyyānikaduka🔽Niyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Aniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Niyyānikañca aniyyānikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  niyyānikaduka  niyyānikam dhammam paṭicca na niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  aniyyānikam dhammam paṭicca na niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  niyyānikam ca aniyyānikam ca dhammam paṭicca na niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: The Pairs🔽A non-leading-on state is an object condition for a leading-on state.🔽A non-leading-on state is an object condition for a non-leading-on state.🔽A non-leading-on state is an object condition for a leading-on state and a non-leading-on state.

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: In the section on cause, there are five. In the section on object, there are two. … In the section on result, there is one. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are five.
